transcript.title: Visit to Torres Strait Islands and Northern Peninsula Area
transcript.content:
At the last election I committed to spending a week every year in a remote Indigenous community.
Â 
This year I have been jointly invited by the Torres Strait Regional Authority, the Torres Shire Council, Torres Strait Island Regional Council and the Northern Peninsula Regional Council to spend a week with their communities.
Â 
Itâs very important that our national leaders focus on the whole of our country, including its most remote parts â so for a week in August the centre of government will move to the Torres Strait Islands and Northern Peninsula Area.
Â 
During this week, this region and its people will be the focus of my attention. I will be accompanied by a number of ministerial colleagues and senior government officials.
Â 
This will be the first visit to this region by an Australian Prime Minister for some time.
Â 
The Government has already made progress in getting children to school, adults into work and making communities safer.
Â 
There is more work to be done, and this visit is an opportunity to review progress in delivering on these priorities.

5 July 2015
